name.text: Calculating the surface area of a square-based pyramid from its net

questiontext.text:
The figure below shows a pyramid. Sketch the net of the pyramid and work out the surface area of the pyramid from its net

Note:Round off your final answer to 2 decimal places.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-50, 500, 500, -50], keepAspectRatio: true, axis: false, showCopyright: false }); // ----------- POINTS (square base + inverted apex) ----------- var A = board.create('point', [100, 150], {name: 'A', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var B = board.create('point', [300, 150], {name: 'B', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var C = board.create('point', [300, 300], {name: 'C', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var D = board.create('point', [100, 300], {name: 'D', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var V = board.create('point', [200, 430], {name: 'V', size: 2, color: 'black'}); // apex below base // ----------- BASE SQUARE (orange) ----------- var base = board.create('polygon', [A, B, C, D], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, fillColor: 'orange', fillOpacity: 0.8, vertices: {visible: false} }); // ----------- SIDE FACES (cyan tones) ----------- var face1 = board.create('polygon', [V, A, B], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.6, vertices: {visible: false} }); var face2 = board.create('polygon', [V, B, C], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.7, vertices: {visible: false} }); var face3 = board.create('polygon', [V, C, D], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.5, vertices: {visible: false} }); var face4 = board.create('polygon', [V, D, A], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.65, vertices: {visible: false} }); // ----------- EDGES TO APEX (for clarity) ----------- board.create('segment', [A, V], {strokeColor: 'black'}); board.create('segment', [B, V], {strokeColor: 'black'}); board.create('segment', [C, V], {strokeColor: 'black'}); board.create('segment', [D, V], {strokeColor: 'black'}); // ----------- LABELS ----------- board.create('text', [180, 130, '{#width#} cm'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); board.create('text', [310, 240, '{#length#} cm'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); board.create('text', [270, 360, '{#slanting_height#} cm'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); [[/jsxgraph]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

(a).The figure below shows the net of the pyramid

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-180, 180, 180, -180], keepAspectRatio: true, axis: false, showCopyright: false }); // ---------- BASE SQUARE (orange) ---------- var A = board.create('point', [-36, 36], {name: '', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var B = board.create('point', [43.2, 36], {name: '', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var C = board.create('point', [43.2, -36], {name: '', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var D = board.create('point', [-36, -36], {name: '', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var base = board.create('polygon', [A, B, C, D], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black', strokeWidth: 1}, fillColor: 'orange', fillOpacity: 0.8, vertices: {visible: false} }); // ---------- TRIANGULAR FACES (cyan) ---------- var V1 = board.create('point', [0, -134.1], {name: '', size: 1, color: 'black'}); var V2 = board.create('point', [0, 134.1], {name: '', size: 1, color: 'black'}); var V3 = board.create('point', [-134.1, 0], {name: '', size: 1, color: 'black'}); var V4 = board.create('point', [134.1, 0], {name: '', size: 1, color: 'black'}); // Top triangle (XDC) board.create('polygon', [D, C, V1], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black', strokeWidth: 1}, fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.8, vertices: {visible: false} }); // Bottom triangle (ABY) board.create('polygon', [A, B, V2], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black', strokeWidth: 1}, fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.8, vertices: {visible: false} }); // Left triangle (DZA) board.create('polygon', [D, A, V3], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black', strokeWidth: 1}, fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.8, vertices: {visible: false} }); // Right triangle (CBV) board.create('polygon', [C, B, V4], { borders: {strokeColor: 'black', strokeWidth: 1}, fillColor: 'cyan', fillOpacity: 0.8, vertices: {visible: false} }); // ---------- PERPENDICULAR DASHED LINES ---------- board.create('segment', [V1, [3.6, -36]], { strokeColor: 'red', dash: 2, strokeWidth: 1 }); board.create('segment', [V2, [3.6, 36]], { strokeColor: 'red', dash: 2, strokeWidth: 1 }); board.create('segment', [V3, [-36, 0]], { strokeColor: 'red', dash: 2, strokeWidth: 1 }); board.create('segment', [V4, [43.2, 0]], { strokeColor: 'red', dash: 2, strokeWidth: 1 }); // ---------- TEXT LABELS ---------- board.create('text', [-46, -41, 'A'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); board.create('text', [48, -41, 'B'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); board.create('text', [-45, 45, 'D'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); board.create('text', [48, 45, 'C'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); board.create('text', [0, -140, 'V'], {fontSize: 14, anchorX: 'middle'}); board.create('text', [0, 145, 'V'], {fontSize: 14, anchorX: 'middle'}); board.create('text', [-140, 5, 'V'], {fontSize: 14, anchorX: 'middle'}); board.create('text', [140, 5, 'V'], {fontSize: 14, anchorX: 'middle'}); // ---------- DIMENSION LABELS ---------- var dim = function(x, y, text, rot=0) { board.create('text', [x, y, text], { fontSize: 10, color: 'black', rotate: rot, anchorX: 'middle' }); }; // Slanting heights dim(-85, -26, '{#slanting_height#} cm'); dim(-38, -80, '{#slanting_height#} cm'); dim(-85, 30, '{#slanting_height#} cm'); dim(-33, 90, '{#slanting_height#} cm'); dim(90, 30, '{#slanting_height#} cm'); dim(35, 90, '{#slanting_height#} cm'); dim(90, -26, '{#slanting_height#} cm'); dim(35, -80, '{#slanting_height#} cm'); // Base dimensions dim(3.6, 32, '{#length#} cm'); dim(-25, 0, '{#width#} cm'); [[/jsxgraph]]

(b). Calculating the surface area

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of the base}&=length\times width\\&={@width@}cm\times{@length@}cm\\&={@base_area@}cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Vertical height}&=\sqrt{{@slanting_height@}^2-{@half_legth@}^2}\\&=\sqrt{{@square_slanting_height@}-{@square_half_length@}}\\&={@vertical_height@} cm\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of a triangular face}&=\frac{1}{2}\times base \times height\\&=\frac{1}{2}\times{@length@} cm\times{@vertical_height@} cm\\&={@area_of_triangle_A@}cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Since all the four triangular faces are similar,then surface area of the faces}&=4\times{@area_of_triangle_A@}\\&={@sum_area_of_triangular_faces@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Surface area of pyramid }&=\text{Area of base}+\text{Area of triangular faces}\\&={@base_area@} cm^2+{@sum_area_of_triangular_faces@}cm^2\\&={@ta@}cm^2\end{align}\)

node.description: It looks like you confused the slanting height of the triangle with the vertical height when calculating the area.

truefeedback.text: It looks like you confused the slanting height of the triangle with the vertical height when calculating the area. Keep in mind that the height used in the calculation of the area of a triangle must be perpendicular to the base. You're on the right track, just be careful to identify the correct height next time

node.description: It seems you used the vertical height of the pyramid instead of the vertical height of the triangular face when working with the area of a triangle.

truefeedback.text: It seems you used the vertical height of the pyramid instead of the vertical height of the triangular face when working with the area of a triangle. For triangle area calculations on a pyramid, use the height of the triangular face, not the vertical height of the whole pyramid.
